questions.question_text:
You use an IMAP-based email system.
You purchase a Microsoft 365 subscription.
In Exchange Online, you create mailboxes for all users.
You need to migrate all the email accounts of all the users to Exchange Online.
Which three components should you create? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: ACE is correct, you need the domain for IMAP migration. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/mailbox-migration/migrating-imap-mailboxes/migrate-other-types-of-imap-mailboxes

Correct answers should be 'A' and 'B'. Again, one of those questions lacking clarity.
'D' is incorrect, as the 'OCT' is available with the 'Hybrid Classic'. OCT is a one-time configuration copy. And it is not relevant to the hybrid agent/modern.
'A' is correct in the context of not needing to open up firewall for free/busy sharing.

comments.content: A: Sorry it does use federation but there is no benefit which is what the question is asking.

discussion.content:
BD
The Hybrid Agent removes some of the challenges you can face when you configure an Exchange Hybrid environment. The agent, which is built on the same technology as the Azure Application Proxy, removes some requirements for external DNS entries, certificate updates and inbound network connections through your firewall to enable Exchange hybrid features.
A: Exchange Modern Hybrid does not use federation.
C: This is irrelevant no matter which you chose.
E: Modern Hybrid does not support Modern Authentication which uses MFA.
https://practical365.com/exchange-server/hybrid-agent-exchange-modern-hybrid-now-available-as-a-public-preview/
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/hybrid-deployment/hybrid-agent

comments.content:
The Question lacks clarity indeed. The table on this article states that OCT is available on all Hybrid options https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/hybrid-configuration-wizard-options 

So since D i available on all options there is now advantage. A on the other can be achieved easier with Full Modern Hybrid.

discussion.content: Finally, for me the correct answer is AB

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory domain named fabrikam.com.
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization that contains two Mailbox servers. The servers are members of a database availability group (DAG).
You plan to implement an Exchange hybrid deployment.
You are evaluating the use of the Exchange Modern Hybrid connection option during the hybrid deployment.
What are two benefits of using Exchange Modern Hybrid instead of Exchange Classic Hybrid? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: eliminates the need to purchase publicly trusted certificates for communication between the on-premises organization and Exchange Online
choices.D: uses Organization Configuration Transfer to configure Exchange Online
choices.C: preserves mailbox quotas when mailboxes are moved between the on-premises organization and Exchange Online
choices.E: allows the use of Microsoft Azure Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for on-premises users
choices.A: allows federated sharing between the on-premises organization and Exchange Online

discussion.content: "You need to ensure that users at Contoso can share their free/busy information with the users at A.Datum." The answer is correct!

A.Datum: sharing policy
Contoso: organization relationship
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/sharing/organization-relationships/create-an-organization-relationship
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/exchange/sharing/sharing-policies/sharing-policies

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
Your company named Contoso, Ltd. has a Microsoft Exchange Online subscription that uses a domain named contoso.com.
Contoso works with a partner company named A.Datum Corporation. A.Datum has an Exchange Server 2016 organization that uses a domain named adatum.com.
You need to ensure that users at Contoso can share their free/busy information with the users at A.Datum.
What should you do for each company? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

comments.content: This answer is right. They asked: Which requirement can only be met by using the Exchange Modern Hybrid connection option. It means ONLY ONE thing can be done with Exchange Modern Hybrid. And it`s ree/busy sharing.
what a messed-up way of phrasing questions. But the answer is correct.

discussion.content: Classic Exchange Hybrid still allows for federated sharing, it just needs to be configured via EWS endpoint

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization.
You purchase an Exchange Online subscription.
You plan to implement an Exchange hybrid deployment that supports the following features:
✑ Federated sharing of free/busy information between organizations.
✑ Single-sign on (SSO) access to both on-premises and Exchange Online mailboxes.
✑ Secured access to mailboxes by using Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) conditional access policies.
✑ A unified global address list (GAL) that contains all the mailboxes in the on-premises and Exchange Online organizations.
You plan to run the Microsoft Office 365 Hybrid Configuration wizard.
You are evaluating whether to use Exchange Classic Hybrid or Exchange Modern Hybrid.
Which requirement can only be met by using the Exchange Modern Hybrid connection option?

choices.D: secured access to mailboxes by using Azure AD conditional access policies.
choices.A: the federated sharing of free/busy information between organizations
choices.B: SSO access to both on-premises and Exchange Online mailboxes
choices.C: a unified GAL list that contains all the mailboxes in the on-premises and Exchange Online organizations

questions.question_text:
Your network contains an Active Directory forest. The forest functional level is Windows Server 2012 R2. The forest contains a Microsoft Exchange Server 2019 organization. Users access their mailbox by using Microsoft Outlook 2016.
You purchase a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
You plan to move 20 mailboxes to Exchange Online.
From Exchange Online, you attempt to perform a remote move migration. When you are prompted to select the users, you discover that there are no users to select.
You need to ensure that you can migrate the users to Exchange Online by using a remote move migration.
What should you do first?

discussion.content: You need to sync the AD accounts to Azure AD before you can select them.
